help.resourceIdentifier: The Resource identifier value must be unique and may only contain supported characters. Please refer to the IGSN Syntax Guidelines for more information on constructing the identifier value.
help.landingPage:
The landing page URL represents the URL that is associated with the IGSN and is the URL users will be redirected to upon resolving the IGSN.

All IGSNs should resolve to a landing page that contains information about the associated sample. Where the IGSN descriptive metadata is not public, this may simply be a page stating that the IGSN is private or under embargo.

When minting a new IGSN, the form will be pre-populated with an ARDC IGSN Portal landing page URL. This may be changed to a landing page URL of your choice.

Note: Only IGSNs marked as “Publicly visible” will be viewable by unauthorised users in the ARDC IGSN
help.registeredObjectType:
Registered Object Type - Select the links below for definition:
  • Physical sample
  • Sample collection
  • Sampling feature
help.visibility:
The visibility of the descriptive metadata for a sample.
  • Publicly visible - The descriptive metadata is publicly visible in the ARDC IGSN portal and exposed via the OAI-PMH protocol for harvesting.
  • Private - The descriptive metadata is only visible by authorised users.
  • Under embargo - Until the embargo date elapses, the descriptive metadata is only visible by authorised users. After the embargo date has elapsed, the descriptive metadata is visible in the ARDC IGSN portal and exposed via the OAI-PMH protocol for harvesting.
help.embargoDate:
Enter an end date for the embargo in one of the following valid W3CDTF formats:

Year:

YYYY (eg 1997)

Year and month:

YYYY-MM (eg 1997-07)

Complete date:

YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16)

Complete date plus hours and minutes: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00)

Note that the descriptive metadata for the resource will not be publicly visible until the embargo date elapses.
help.resourceTitle: Short title or description of the sample, e.g. Zircons from fraser range amphibolite on expoxy SHRIMP mount sample number 175423
help.logDate: Use this element to indicate an event (the status of a resource or its registration) and its timestamp

help.curationDetails: Resource archival information, mainly applicable to physical samples and sample collections. The curating institution must be specified. This can be present or future curator.
help.curatorName: The full name of the sample or data curator.
help.curatorIdentifier: A unique identifier that identifies the curator.
help.identifierType:
Identifier type

  • ARK - Archival Resource Key.
  • arXiv - Identifier for scholarly articles in arXiv archive
  • bibcode - Bibcode identifier.
  • DOI - Digital Object Identifier.
  • EAN13 - International Article Number (also known as European Article Number or EAN)
  • EISSN - Electronic International Standard Serial Number (e-ISSN)
  • Handle - Handle identifier.
  • IGSN - International Geo Sample Number
  • ISBN - International Standard Book Number 
  • ISNI -  International Standard Name Identifier
  • ISSN - International Standard Serial Number 
  • ISTC -  International Standard Text Code 
  • LISSN - Linking ISSN (ISSN-L)
  • Local - local identifier scheme
  • LSID - Life Science Identifier
  • ORCID - Open Researcher and Contributor ID
  • PMID - PubMed record identifier
  • PURL - Persistent Uniform Resource Locator  
  • ROR - Research Organization Registry identifier
  • UPC - Universal Product Code.
  • URL - Uniform Resource Locator. 
  • URN - Uniform Resource Name.
  • VIAF - Virtual International Authority File
help.curationDate:
The date the sample or item was moved to its current location.

Year:

YYYY (eg 1997)

Year and month:

YYYY-MM (eg 1997-07)

Complete date:

YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16)

Complete date plus hours and minutes: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00)
help.curationLocation: The location (address) where the sample or item is stored. This can be general or specific (room number, building name).
help.curatingInstitution: The institution where the sample or item is stored.
help.institutionURI: The URL of the institution where the sample or item is stored.
help.relatedResourceRelationType:
The relationship between the resource being registered and other entity (e.g., event, document, parent sample, etc.)

  • Collected as part of - indicates that the resource was collected as part of an activity or project.
  • Has association with - has an undefined relationship with the related resource.
  • Has digital representation - this relation maybe used to reference ae digitized version of a physical sample;inverse relation of 'isDigitalRepresentationOf'.
  • Has reference resource - indicates the relation between a sample and its reference sample. A physical sample is usually inspected for identity, physical purity and compared with a reference sample.
  • Has sampling feature - this relates a sampling feature (observation well) to a physical sample (water specimen); inverse relation of 'isSamplingFeatureOf'.
  • Is aggregate of - indicates that the resource is an arbitrary aggregation of the related (target) resource.
  • Is derived from - indicates that the resource is created/obtained from a parent resource.
  • Is digital representation of - this relation maybe used to indicate the digitized version of a physical sample.
  • Is documented by - indicates the documentation of the resource, including datasets, reports, images, supplementary metadata, etc.
  • Is identical to - a resource that is the same as the registered resource.
  • Is member of - indicates the registered resource is used to compile or create the target resource (related resource); inverse relation of 'isAggregateOf'.
  • Is sampling feature of - this relates a physical sample (water specimen) to its sampling feature (observation well).
  • Is source of - indicates the resource A is a source upon which the resource B is based); inverse relation of 'derivedFrom'.
  • Participates - A resource participates in an event.
help.contributorIdentifier: A unique identifier that identifies the contributor.
help.contributorType:
Contributor type

  • Collaborator
  • Contributor
  • Custodian
  • Funder
  • Originator
  • Owner
  • Point of contact
  • Principal investigator
  • Processor
  • Rights holder
  • Sponsor
  • Stakeholder
  • User
help.alternateIdentifier: Alternate identifiers of the geosample including the local and other web-resolvable identifiers.
help.relatedResourceIdentifier: A unique identifier that identifies the related resource.
help.classification: Domain-specific classification, e.g. I.U.G.S classification scheme for igneous rocks, The Spectral Geologist (TSG) for the identification of the mineral reference spectral
help.classificationURL: The URL of any web page that describes the classification.
help.sampledFeatureURI: The URL of any web page that describes the sampled feature.
help.classificationURI: The URL of any web page that describes the classification.
help.purpose: The purpose for collecting/creating the sample or item
help.sampledFeature: The real world feature that was sampled. e.g. rock outcrop or aquifer
help.method: The method/instrument by which the sample or item was collected/created, e.g., rock chip sampling, percussion drill hole.
help.methodURL: The URL of any web page that describes method/instrument by which the sample or item was collected/created, e.g., rock chip sampling, percussion drill hole.
help.project: The field program or project name in which the samples or data were collected
help.comments: Free text describing the sample or item. This can also be used to include additional metadata which cannot be specified with the standard schema elements.
help.date:
The time period or date of the collection/creation of the sample or item.

Year:

YYYY (eg 1997)

Year and month:

YYYY-MM (eg 1997-07)

Complete date:

YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16)

Complete date plus hours and minutes: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00)
help.location: The location where the resource was found/collected (sampling feature,specimen) or created (synthetic materials). This may refer to a geographic location (in Well Known Text format POINT(Long Lat), e.g POINT (115.8834, -31.9944)) or a locality. For a spatial location, the Spatial Reference System Identifier(SRID) attribute may be used to indicate the spatial reference system (in European Petroleum Survey Group, EPSG). This refers to the Spatial Referencing system Identifier (SRID). Specify an EPSG code, e.g., '4326' is the EPSG code for the WGS84 geographic coordinate system.
help.locality: The place name or address. You may use the attribute locality Identifier(URL for location on web-based map e.g map.google.com) to denote the web location of a place.
help.localityURL: URL for location on web-based map (e.g map.google.com) to denote the web location of a place.
help.wkt: Well Known Text (WKT) is a text markup language for representing vector geometry objects on a map, This may refer to a geographic location. In Well Known Text, the format is POINT (Long Lat), e.g. POINT (115.8834 -31.9944)
help.verticalDatum:
A vertical datum specifies the origin for elevations associated with a sample or item. Specify the European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG) vertical coordinate reference system code. For example, 5711 refers is the EPSG code for the Australian Height Datum (AHD).

  • EPSG:3112 - Projected coordinate system
  • EPSG:4283 - Geodetic coordinate system
  • EPSG:4326 - Geodetic coordinate system
  • EPSG:4939 - Geodetic 3D coordinate system
  • EPSG:5711 - Vertical coordinate system
  • EPSG:5712 - Vertical coordinate system
  • EPSG:8311 - NAD83(2011) / Oregon Burns-Harper zone (m)
help.geometryURL: Website to display or download sample locations.
help.srid:
This refers to the Spatial Referencing system IDentifier (SRID). For example, '4326' is the EPSG code for the WGS84 geographic coordinate system.

  • EPSG:3112 - Projected coordinate system
  • EPSG:4283 - Geodetic coordinate system
  • EPSG:4326 - Geodetic coordinate system
  • EPSG:4939 - Geodetic 3D coordinate system
  • EPSG:5711 - Vertical coordinate system
  • EPSG:5712 - Vertical coordinate system
  • EPSG:8311 - NAD83(2011) / Oregon Burns-Harper zone (m)
help.wgs84: Specify the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84) coordinates of where the resource was found/collected using either Decimal Degrees or Degrees, Minutes, Seconds.

validation.resourceIdentifier: Identifier suffix may only contain the  characters A-Z, 0-9, "-" (hyphen) or "." (period).
validation.url: Please enter a valid URL. E.g. https://example.com
validation.resourceTitle: Provide a title for the sample or item
validation.resourceType: Select a sample or item type
validation.curatorName: Enter the name of the resource curator
validation.curatorIdentifier: Identifier must be provided when specifying an identifier for a curator
validation.curatorIdentifierType: Creator Identifier type must be provided when specifying an identifier for a creator.
validation.date: Enter a valid date in the YYYY-MM-DD format
validation.relatedResourceIdentifier: Related Identifier must be provided when specifying a related resource
validation.relatedResourceIdentifierType: Identifier type must be provided when specifying an identifier for a related resource
validation.relatedResourceRelationType: Relation type must be provided when specifying a related resource
validation.contributorType: Contributor type must be provided when specifying a contributor
validation.contributorName: Name must be provided when specifying a contributor
validation.contributorIdentifier: Identifier must be provided when specifying an identifier for a contributor
validation.contributorIdentifierType: Identifier type must be provided when specifying an identifier for a contributor
validation.alternateIdentifierType: Alternate Identifier type must be provided when specifying an alternate identifier
